page.title: 19CRAMOND :A Local Mum
page.content: We interviewed ten mums to ask their opinions about living in Cramond. The lady June, Paul, Susan and I interviewed on 17 June 1985 was Mrs Aitken. She is the secretary of the Cramond Association. This Association was formed because residents wanted Cramond to be pleasant and tidy and they wanted to organise entertainments and to share their hobbies. Mrs Aitken has lived in Cramond for about thirty years. She lives with her husband. They have a pet. It is a cat called Tibby. Mrs Aitken thinks that the local shop prices are average. The shops she visits most are the supermarkets at Barnton, East Craigs and Davidsons Mains. She usually travels in her car which is a mini. When she has any spare time she watches TV, reads books and does gardening. She goes to Cramond Kirk.
